I think it's clearer using the .orElse() method:
.orElse(() -> HealthCheckResponse.up("Default persistence"));
timeline.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: Also, maybe it should say "In Memory Persistence"? What do you think?
replies.author: Sgitario

timeline.bodyText: The format added some whitespaces here.
timeline.author: Sgitario

timeline.bodyText:
I was told that if we enable the events, then the topics must be created in Data Index (see comment).
So, as I understood, we don't need to create any topic here, just to wait until data index component creates it.
timeline.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText: But IMHO the Data index component is not mandatory for Jobs service. So I think that topic creation is ok in this case.
replies.author: sutaakar

replies.bodyText: If so, then we should add some unit tests to cover this functionality. cc @tiagodolphine
replies.author: Sgitario

replies.bodyText:
IMO since the topic is an infrastructure requirement it should be created by the operator, this method is just to make things easier to test and a kind of fallback in case the topic is not yet created. And in this case, job service is the producer, it is not coupled with data-index, I mean it could produce events even if data-index is not up and running or even not present on the architecture.
@Sgitario yeah, it would be great to add some unit tests, I'll provide it.
